attributes.action: Exempt the A4 from Bristol Clean Air Zone
attributes.background: The A4 is a route that is unavoidable for most travel on the west of Bristol. The proposed Clean Air Zone should not cover this route. I propose that the Clean Air Zone go ahead without the A4 being included.
attributes.additional_details: The addition of the A4 in the Bristol Clean Air Zone will force drivers onto other surrounding roads, increasing pollution and disruption in these areas. The use of the A4 is unavoidable and thus makes this a money generating exercise and not about reducing pollution in the populated areas covered by the Clean Air Zone.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic packaging for non-food and non-sterile products
attributes.background:
Plastic packaging for anything other than food products and sterile products needs to be banned.
eg. Magazines, cards, notebooks, razors, toys, hardware, tools, stationery, candles, electronics & gadgets (chargers, earphones, cables) homeware etc...
attributes.additional_details:
A big reduction of plastic waste can be achieved, quickly, by banning plastic packaging for such products, as viable alternatives already exist. 
Most plastics used for packaging can't be recycled, so we must avoid producing more than strictly necessary.
Wasted plastics break down into particles which end up polluting ecosystems and the internal organs of humans.
These manufacturers are still driving demand for new, non-recyclable plastic packaging, therefore government intervention is needed.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban the use of plastic packaging for all non-food items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570065

Ban excess packaging (eg. plastic wrapped items within more plastic, multipacks): https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561755

attributes.action: Replace bottled water with water fountains in the UK
attributes.background: Single use water bottles need to be replaced. Fountains could be filled with water supplied by bottled water companies. Customers could be charged to fill up their own reusable water bottles with water from these fountains.
attributes.additional_details:
Bottled water is pointless and dangerous. It's suffocating marine animals, leaching micro plastics into our water supplies and contains chemicals that harm human health.
Plastic is not sustainable. Its main component is alkenes obtained from  oil, and it can't be recycled indefinitely. 
Plastic is polluting the environment, it’s bad for human health and it’s not sustainable. We have got to stop being so dependent on it and must remove unnecessary plastic items.

rejection.details:
It is up to individual businesses whether to sell bottled water or establish commercial water filling stations.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make drinking water facilities mandatory in service stations and town centres: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334268

We could also accept a petition calling for the Government to ban water being sold in single-use plastic bottles, if that's something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Replace New Year's Fireworks with Only Light and Drone Show
attributes.background: Fireworks cause extensive air pollution in a very short amount of time, and leave metal particles, dangerous toxins, harmful chemicals and smoke in the air for hours and days. Most of which never fully decompose, and instead stay in the environment, causing harm to animals, plants etc.
attributes.additional_details: The 2021 New Year's Firework event, was called the "most environmentally-friendly New Year’s Eve event to date", by the London Mayor, since it included drones and lighting. However, the display still included fireworks, even after reflecting on David Attenborough's message about how the environment is suffering. Therefore, it would be MORE environmentally-friendly to completely cut the firework display from the event, especially as the light and drone show was more than spectacular.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The London Assembly/Mayor of London who organised this display have their own petitions system: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Introduce a carbon tax on large corporations. They should be held responsible.
attributes.background: Tax large companies on their co2 emissions both nationally and globally, have consequences for those companies who we know pollute and damage the environment. Put this money back into funding new renewable, nuclear, and hydrogen fuel technologies and fund the scientific breakthroughs we need.
attributes.additional_details: If we can tax sugar to protect public health or introduce a lockdown to save lives, why can't we tax those companies who are not held responsible for their environmental damage and CO2 emissions. Climate change will cause more deaths then corona and action must be taken to save those lives. We have both a legal and moral obligation to tackle this and the responsibility lies with both governments and TNCs. If we don't hold them responsible you are committing us to extinction.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321854

Your petition refers to large corporations, and taxing both national and global emissions, but it is not clear how this would work in practice.

If you want the Government to take an action different to that requested by the above petition you could start a new petition stating more clearly what you want the Government to do.

attributes.action: Switch certain traffic lights off
attributes.background: Switch traffic lights to flash amber as they do in places like Italy, so you don't have to stop and go. More pollution and dust is made by stopping/starting.
attributes.additional_details: For example, in the south, say after 9pm there are hardly any cars on the road, so why stop at pointless traffic lights.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to change how traffic lights operate, but we're not sure exactly what changes you would like the Government to make.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, changing the rules for traffic lights so road users are not required to stop at amber lights.

attributes.action: Require all new-build supermarkets to be built with a living green roof
attributes.background: Government should introduce legislation requiring all new-build supermarkets to be built with a living green roof.  These help lower the supermarket’s carbon footprint, increase its energy efficiency, reduce surface run-off following rain and improve overall air quality for the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Air pollution is the biggest environmental cause of poor health. Up to 1,200 deaths each year in Greater Manchester are contributed to by poor air quality, which is likely to be increased by Covid-19. 
LIDL are proposing to build a new supermarket at Mocha Parade, Salford.  Two years ago they built a store in Malmesbury in Wiltshire with a living green roof.  Unless the government introduces legislation, LIDL and their competitors will not do the same in Salford or elsewhere.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338.

attributes.action: Ban noisy fireworks.
attributes.background:
They are a threat to wildlife, domestic animals are air pollutants and cause fear to some children,  especially autistic children. 
We watch in awe at Sir D Attenborough's attempts to care for our environment and then bombard our wildlife with petrifying noise
attributes.additional_details: It's 2020. We banned using animals at the circus as it was considered a form of cruelty.  It's now time to move away from barbarism of noisy fireworks

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

attributes.action: Ban fireworks that bang, they frighten pets, wildlife and are noise pollution.
attributes.background: Ban the production and sale of fireworks that go bang.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone with a cat or dog knows that loud fireworks are frightening to their pets. Loud fireworks frighten wildlife. Loud fireworks are noise pollution to people trying to lead a peaceful life. Why should we have to put up with the noise so some people can enjoy making as much noise as they can? Firework bangs seem to get louder each year and people seem to be letting off fireworks weeks before November 5th and weeks afterward.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

While some fireworks are marketed as silent, these still make some noise. If you would like the Government to reduce the decibel limit to a specific level, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to members of the public
attributes.background: Fireworks should be banned from being sold to members of the public. Shops cannot sell them in-store or online. Only large events which are not formed by individual members of the public can launch fireworks.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks cause a lot of air pollution and smoke, and it makes people with breathing difficulties very hard to breathe. Pets are also very scared of the loud noises from fireworks, and it has resulted in many deaths. The constant, loud, irritating noise of exploding fireworks all day is a complete nuisance. Babies and children cannot sleep because of the noise, and the elderly and disabled also suffer greatly from this extreme problem.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: I would like Fireworks banned throughout the UK .. They are not needed in 2020..
attributes.background: I want fireworks made obsolete.. They have no place in society in 2020.. They cause immense suffering to millions of pets and farm animals throughout the United Kingdom from the noise and hundreds of animals and people are maimed or killed every year from fireworks deliberately being thrown.
attributes.additional_details: Each year London uses tax payers money to fund the New Year Eve celebrations where fireworks are set off at the end.. Fireworks cause environmental damage and noise pollution.  Ten minutes enjoyment from looking in the sky to the hours and sometimes years of misery people  and animals have to endure where they've been maimed by a firework is not worth it.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Stop unattended roadworks, get work the done quickly to keep roads clear
attributes.background: Make contractors complete roadworks quickly to stop unattended works blocking the roads and stopping traffic moving around. This will stop so many traffic jams due to roads being blocked off with no one working there for weeks on end.
attributes.additional_details: This will keep the roads clear and therefore the economy moving as transport will be able to get goods from a to b without having to negotiate blocked roads. It will also cut travelling times for commuters, school runs etc. It will also cut down on speeding, air pollution and road rage.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. It's already the case that fines can be levied for late-finished roadworks.  You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/street-works
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Legalise E Scooters to help fight the Carbon footprint and congestion
attributes.background:
Make electric scooters legal to reduce our carbon footprint / cut emissions.
Allow owners to register there privately owned e scooters with the DvLA and get insurance so they can be responsible riders
attributes.additional_details:
Legalising privately owned e scooters that are insured and registered to the owner will make riders responsible 
for there actions which will make e scooters safer on the road.
It will help commuters get to and from work safety during this difficult time with Covid-19 which will help the economy keep going.
This is the best and safest way forward at the moment to avoid catching the virus.
So it’s good for helping with  pollution
and keeping us safe from Covid while we get through this tough time

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332067

attributes.action: Stop the Ealing Lower Traffic Neighbourhood Scheme.
attributes.background:
The Government need to stop Ealing Council from continuing this scheme. It is going against the very aims it has set out to achieve. It has not lowered the traffic but has created more traffic than before. It is directing the pollution to the main roads and harming the cyclists. 
They need to act.
attributes.additional_details:
Ealing Council has implemented this scheme without consulting its residents beforehand.
The aims of the petition are: Evidence based data on traffic on the roads in question; Success criteria and measurements pre and post trial; A consultation period; How the council thinks this will benefit the emergency services and to reduce the trial period.
This petition is also on:
https://www.change.org/p/ealing-council-objection-to-ealing-s-lower-traffic-neighbourhood-ltns

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Ealing Council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You may wish to sign this petition asking for the UK Government to remove guidance and funding for councils to introduce temporary traffic measures: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552306

attributes.background:
Like Many we suffer from Asthma, Smoke can and do bring on Attacks and could Kill people with Lung Issues, the Clean Air act goes out the window and Pollution in.

Then there is Smoke Damage to Washing on the line and Bedrooms, in this so called Modern age there are Tips where Rubbish can be took.
attributes.additional_details:
On Health Grounds as above, costs the NHS money if and when Asthma Attacks happen and you are taken to Hospital, should be common sense, someone would be Liable if someone died through others being Lazy, there are Government Departments saying about getting our AIR cleaned up and then these who Polluted the air burning Various things, this should have been dealt with many years ago.

For the sake of the above let’s get things up to date.

We like many we guess have had Attacks due to no control.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330421

attributes.action: Extend Oyster to all of Thurrock - Tilbury Town, East Tilbury & Stanford Le Hope
attributes.background: I want the Government or Parliament to extend Oyster to all of Thurrock (Tilbury Town, East Tilbury and Stanford-Le-Hope).
attributes.additional_details:
TFL's Oyster Card covers some of Thurrock but not all of it.

Tilbury Town, East Tilbury and Stanford Le Hope are excluded despite being very much part of Thurrock 

As we need to use public transport more and our cars less, in such a polluted borough,  making train travel easier would be most welcome.

Also, it would be more easier to pay with Oyster instead of having to buy a ticket because so people might come from a station that does use Oyster but doesn’t know that those stations don’t.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. The Oyster network is the responsibility of TfL and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Grant the Environment Agency powers to monitor and penalise water companies.
attributes.background: Water companies and landowners should be monitored by the Environment Agency and if they are found to be polluting rivers they should be penalised. There should be investment in the sewage system so that it operates more efficiently in extreme weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 the government acknowledged that only 14% of English rivers are in good ecological condition.  Despite this they have not brought in measures to monitor how water companies and landowners are misusing our rivers and ,through the Environment Agency,  are not penalizing companies and landowners who routinely pollute our waterways. Last year 1.5m hours of raw sewage was pumped into English rivers posing a serious risk to human health as well as damaging the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330416

attributes.action: Make it illegal for vehicle drivers to leave engines idling when stationary.
attributes.background: Fine vehicle drivers who pollute by leaving their engine idling, and give licence penalty points.
attributes.additional_details: Such behaviour seems to be on the increase. It can be witnessed daily in my small town, and even when politely challenged, drivers do not turn their engines off. Such willful and totally unnecessary damage to public health and the environment cannot be left in the hands of vehicle drivers to do as they wish, but should be made an offence. The public should then be given the tools to report such offenders. Air pollution kills thousands of people a year, and protecting the environment is the responsibility of all of us, not some.

rejection.details:
It is already the law that, when a vehicle is stationary, drivers must stop the engine of a car, unless certain exceptions apply. There are also legal provisions for local authorities to be granted powers to issue fixed penalty fines in relation to idling offences.

Decisions about enforcement action are a matter for local police forces and local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to change the rules around vehicle idling, by increasing penalties or broadening the offence, but you would need to make it clear how you want current rules to change.

attributes.action: Legalise electric and e-scooters on public roads
attributes.background: I would like the government to legalise electric  and e-scooters on public roads
attributes.additional_details: This is because they are alot more safer than getting on public transport during a serious pandemic that has killed millions of people. Electric and e-scooter is a new way of getting from A-B they are safer than bike plus there is no rules out there for the electric bikes that have been built if these get legalised there would be less pollution in the country as they are very popular, yes there should be some rules and regulation when using one but the government have gone in too hard with the law as the electric bikes have not got them kind of rules.

attributes.background: I would like the government to enforce £1000 fines for anybody that litters on beaches. Plastic waste polluting the sea has become an increasing problem worldwide. The recent displays of public ignorance should not go unnoticed in order to keep our planet clean.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the enforcement of £1000 fines for littering on beaches will deter most people from leaving waste scattered across the sand and raise awareness of these thoughtless actions.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.action: Legalise the use of electric scooters on UK roads
attributes.background: Immediately legalise the use of electric scooters on UK roads. Legislation should include wording to ensure rider and public safety. Appropriate rules include a speed limit of 15mph and it should be compulsory to wear a helmet. Failure to abide by the rules should result in fines.
attributes.additional_details: In light of Coronavirus, we urgently need alternative and sustainable methods of transportation that will limit the spread of the disease and relieve pressures on public transport as people try and get back to normality. Furthermore, electric scooters are an ecologically friendly mode of transport and can contribute to reducing emissions and pollution in our cities.

attributes.action: Encourage employers to allow their employees to work from home
attributes.background: During lockdown there has been a massive reduction on air pollution, much of which must be down to more people working from home.
attributes.additional_details: Less air pollution for everyone, better health and less illness. Wildlife returning to areas where they been absent for many years. Less time travelling by car and public transport = a cleaner environment, less time travelling for the employee, less stress, more quality time with family due to wasted travelling time.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: Strengthen the rules around removal of DPFs and other emissions devices.
attributes.background:
Strengthen the regulations around the removal emissions reductions devices.
Put measures in place to prevent garages from removing or advertising the removal of such devices Increase punishment for those performing such services, and for owners/drivers of such vehicles & increase ease of reporting.
attributes.additional_details:
The driving of a vehicle with emissions reduction systems removed is currently illegal, but there are no sufficient measures in place to prevent the removal or punish those who do.
Reporting of violators is also not easily done.
Emissions reductions systems are put in place to reduce pollution and in the interest of public health. Thousands selfishly remove these devices and contribute to environmental and health problems and face no recourse for these actions.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the illegal removal of diesel particulate filters, but it's not clear what you want the Government or House of Commons to do about this.

As you state in your petition, it is already illegal to remove a DPF, and since February 2014 the inspection of the exhaust system carried out during the MOT test includes a check for the presence of a DPF. A missing DPF, where one was fitted when the vehicle was built, will result in an MOT failure.

Investigating and taking action in respect of potential offences under these rules is a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, and not the Government or House of Commons.

Regarding the advertising or services to remove DPFs, this would be a matter for the Advertising Standards Authority, which in 2016 took action in respect of an advert about remobal of DPFs which breached their rules: https://www.asa.org.uk/rulings/avon-tuning-ltd-a16-356800.html

If you believe someone has committed an offence related to the removal of a DPF you should report this to the police, and if you believe someone is advertising illegal services you should report this to the ASA.

Report a crime: https://www.police.uk/pu/contact-the-police/report-a-crime-incident/

Make a complaint to the ASA: https://www.asa.org.uk/make-a-complaint.html

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQ's in the countryside and all public outdoor spaces
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to put a ban on the use of disposable BBQ's in all public outdoor spaces. This would include national parks, open moorland, country parks, public beaches and all other public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's not only are the cause of so many accidental fires and scorch marks causing damage to wildlife habitat's and fauna all across he country, they also have a massive part to play in litter pollution when left behind after use. Not only can they not be recycled or composted but also have sharp wire mesh that could injure or kill animals and the foil tray is a natural heat source when left in the suns rays causing a possible fire. Each fire cost thousands in resources to extinguish.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323233

attributes.action: Enact a transformative Green New Deal for the UK
attributes.background: Bouncing back to black fossil fuels is not an option. Burning fossil fuels is the main cause of air pollution (DEFRA). Tragically, air pollution kills 40,000 people in the UK every year (Royal College of Physicians and the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health, 2016). This must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
A transformative Green New Deal is the answer. An ambitious plan that will secure a safe climate and fairer society by totally transforming our economy (Green New Deal UK, 2019).

The Green New Deal must put the UK on a net zero greenhouse gas emissions trajectory to limit global heating to 1.5 degrees. It must also be built on the principles of social, economic and environmental justice. 

It is time for a green recovery where the health and wellbeing of all people and the planet are put first.

attributes.action: Legalise Electric Scooters for a greener economy post Covid-19
attributes.background: There was discussions that post Covid-19, we should re-open the economy as a greener, more environmentally friendly economy. attributes.action: No return to 'Business as usual' after COVID 19 restrictions lifted.
attributes.background: This has shown that people can accomodate huge changes in short spaces of time. People want major changes after lockdown ends. Pollution has gone down, energy consumption has gone down, nature is recovering. People are buying more locally produced food items. People are appreciating the work of proffessions that have long gone unrecognised or considered menial(nurses, teachers, shop staff). People are walking & cycling more, and in some ways are now connecting (virtually) more with friends and family all over the world. 
We want to continue down this less destructive path.

attributes.action: Enforce a full UK lockdown for 1 week every year to ease the effect of pollution

attributes.action: Plant coral forests and save existing coral forests.
attributes.background:
Coral reefs are dying around the world. Damaging activities include coral mining, pollution, overfishing, blast fishing, the digging of canals and access into islands and bays. Climate change, such as warming temperatures, causes coral bleaching, which if severe kills the coral.
STOP THIS!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Coral trees absorb 4 times as much carbon dioxide as trees do!!! This means that coral forests are 4 times more valuable than forests.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly whether you want the UK Government to fund the creation of coral reefs in UK waters, or to support global efforts to increase coral reefs. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Protect the skies of the United Kingdom from Starlink pollution
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to immediately regulate the Starlink project which, in its current form, is creating pollution that outranks light pollution to the nth degree
attributes.additional_details: Sir Patrick Moore, Heather Couper, George Airy, Arthur Eddington and Sir Issac Newton, all of them British and all of them astronomers who have helped the world in research into the skies. This project, designed by the SpaceX corporation, has the potential to ruin the skies for future generations and in doing so, prevent the United Kingdom taking its rightful place at the head of astronomy in the world.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

The use of space is governed by international treaties, and each state is internationally responsible and liable for its space activities, including activities carried out by non-governmental entities of that state. As SpaceX, the company leading on the Starlink project, is an American company, their activites are the responsibility of the US Government.

You could raise a petition asking the Government to urge the US Government to look into the concerns you set out regarding the Starlink project.
